definition: harsh inflexibility in opinion, temper, or judgment : severity, the quality of being unyielding or inflexible : strictness, severity of life : austerity
examples: The least one might observe is that this muddle of moralism and laxity, extreme rigor and casual permissiveness, arduous altruism and nonchalant selfishness, has consequences.
Their abandonment of this terminology is part of an effort to soften the rigor of some of the rigid consequences thought to flow from the mechanical application of this dichotomy.
— John D. Calamari and Joseph M. Perillo
… a moral rigor and growth that might help this country.

definition: an act or instance of strictness, severity, or cruelty
examples: … the humanist must recognize the normality, the practical necessity of the very rigors he is trying to soften and correct.

definition: a tremor caused by a chill
examples: This young woman presented at the hospital with severe abdominal pain and signs of infection, including fever, rigor, and leukocytosis.

definition: a condition that makes life difficult, challenging, or uncomfortable, extremity of cold
examples: the rigors of a New England winter
Tentatively one might suggest that what characterizes science is the rigor of its methodology …

definition: rigidness or torpor of organs or tissue that prevents response to stimuli

examples: A fish has its best flavor and texture when cooked while just coming out of rigor.
